IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: The mission of the Washington Redskins Charitable Foundation is to make a positive and measurable impact in the lives of children in our community. SEE SCHEDULE O.
IRS990.Desc: Youth Football: Assist youth players, coaches and parents in promoting the game of football through proper instruction, education and sportsmanship Flag Football Clinics Coaches Clinics Moms Clinics Special Olympics Flag Football League Punt, Pass and Kick Competition

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Start Smart: Provide elementary school students with the resources they need to confidently go back to school and bring excitement to learning initiatives to encourage development, specifically literacy, throughout the year. Redskins Read Program Back to School Fair Library READesigns Book Drives

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: Live Well: Educate kids on how to live well by eating right and encourage all young fans to be active for at least 60 minutes a day. Included in this focus area are the following sub-programs: Redskins FITT Program Play 60 Program Salute to Play 60 Fuel Up to Play 60 Playground Builds Good Sports Equipment Donations

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Foundation is an organization described in Section 170(c) of the Internal Revenue Service Code (the "Code") and is exempt from taxation under Section 501(c)(3) of the Code. ASC 740, Income Taxes, prescribes a recognition threshold and a measurement attribute for the financial statement recognition and measurement of tax positions taken or expected to be taken in a tax return as well as guidance on de-recognition, classification, interest and penalties and financial statement reporting disclosures. For these benefits to be recognized, a tax position must be more-likely-than-not to be sustained upon examination by taxing authorities. The amount recognized is measured as the largest amount of benefit that is greater than fifty percent likely of being realized upon ultimate settlement. The Foundation has considered its income tax positions,including any positions that may be considered uncertain by the relevant tax authorities in the jurisdictions in which the Foundation operates. As of March 31, 2018 and 2017, the Foundation had not identified any uncertain tax positions and no unrecognized tax exposures. The Foundation is subject to routine audits by taxing jurisdictions; however, there are currently no audits for any tax periods in progress.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE G, PART III, LINE 16, DESCRIPTION OF SERVICES PROVIDED:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: OVERSAW THE PLANNING AND IMPLEMENTATION OF THE CHARITABLE FOUNDATIONS TRAINING CAMP AND GAME DAY RAFFLES. THIS INCLUDED DEVELOPING MARKETING CAMPAIGNS, SETTING TICKET PRICES, DETERMINING SELLING LOCATIONS, SELECTING BENEFIT ORGANIZATIONS, AND ENSURING REGULATORY REQUIREMENTS WERE MET.

RecipientBusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: Boys & Girls Club of Greater Washington
Judith P Hoyer ECC PTA Inc

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FOUNDATION DESIGNS AND IMPLEMENTS SIGNATURE COMMUNITY PROGRAMS ORGANIZATIONS AND INDIVIDUALS ARE SELECTED BY THE FOUNDATION TO RECEIVE CONTRIBUTIONS BASED UPON THEIR NEED IN THE AREA OF THESE PROGRAMS FOR LOCAL YOUTH. THE FOUNDATION MONITORS THE USE OF THESE FUNDS THROUGH BOARD MEETINGS AND REVIEW OF THE ENTITY'S FINANCIAL INFORMATI ON.

Donations collected for the Toys For Tots Program 6. Funding for the Ready to Work Program in Prince George's County high schools 7. Donations 8. Event Dinner Sponsor 9. 50/50 Raffle proceeds and funds raised on Fight on Campaign t-shirt sales
Part I, column (b) represents the number of CONTRIBUTIONS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART I, LINE 1: Mission or most significant activities
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Washington Redskins Charitable Foundation, Inc. (the "Foundation") was incorporated in the State of Delaware. The Foundation is ever-present in the community, constantly working to achieve our mission to make a positive and measurable impact in the lives of children that need it most. Since Redskins owners Dan and Tanya Snyder created the Washington Redskins Charitable Foundation in 2000, it has given back nearly $20MM to the community and currently provide support and services to more than 190,000 individuals (mostly children) annually, focusing on supporting education, childrens health and wellness and preparing them for their future. The Washington Redskins Charitable Foundation works to deliver our mission through education, community outreach and health and wellness initiatives to elementary through high school-age students in the region.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART III, LINE 1: ORGANIZATION'S MISSION
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE WASHINGTON REDSKINS CHARITABLE FOUNDATION, INC. (THE "FOUNDATION") WAS INCORPORATED IN THE STATE OF DELAWARE. THE FOUNDATION IS EVER-PRESENT IN THE COMMUNITY, CONSTANTLY WORKING TO ACHIEVE OUR MISSION TO MAKE A POSITIVE AND MEASURABLE IMPACT IN THE LIVES OF CHILDREN THAT NEED IT MOST. SINCE REDSKINS OWNERS DAN AND TANYA SNYDER CREATED THE WASHINGTON REDSKINS CHARITABLE FOUNDATION IN 2000, IT HAS GIVEN BACK NEARLY $20MM TO THE COMMUNITY AND CURRENTLY PROVIDE SUPPORT AND SERVICES TO MORE THAN 190,000 INDIVIDUALS (MOSTLY CHILDREN) ANNUALLY, FOCUSING ON SUPPORTING EDUCATION, CHILDRENS HEALTH AND WELLNESS AND PREPARING THEM FOR THEIR FUTURE.THE WASHINGTON REDSKINS CHARITABLE FOUNDATION WORKS TO DELIVER OUR MISSION THROUGH EDUCATION, COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND HEALTH AND WELLNESS INITIATIVES TO ELEMENTARY THROUGH HIGH SCHOOL-AGE STUDENTS IN THE REGION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The organization's Form 990 undergoes a number of internal and external reviews before it is filed with the IRS. The return is prepared by the organization's public accounting firm, BDO USA and is reviewed by the organization's Finance Department and the Program Director. A final draft is then provided to the President of the Foundation for review, comment, and sign off before it is filed with the IRS. A copy of the Form 990 is available to all board members for review prior to filing.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION REQUIRES THAT EACH MEMBER OF THE BOARD REVIEW THE ORGANIZATION'S CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY ON AN ANNUAL BASIS AND RETURN AN ACKNOWLEDGEMENT OF RECEIPT AND DISCLOSURE OF ANY POTENTIAL CONFLICTS OF INTEREST. IN THE EVENT OF A CONFLICT OF INTEREST, THE BOARD REVIEWS THE CONFLICT TO ASSESS ITS IMPACT ON THE FOUNDATION. THE BOARD VOTES ON THE MATTER FOR RESOLUTION. THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR OF THE CHARITABLE FOUNDATION PERIODICALLY MONITORS MEMBERS AND POTENTIAL CONFLICTS OF INTEREST THAT MAY ARISE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS DETERMINES THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR'S SALARY TAKING INTO ACCOUNT INDUSTRY STANDARDS. NO OTHER BOARD MEMBER OR OFFICER IS PAID BY THE FOUNDATION. THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR AND BOARD OF DIRECTORS DETERMINES KEY EMPLOYEES SALARY TAKING INTO ACCOUNT INDUSTRY STANDARDS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: UPON REQUEST, THE GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART XII, LINE 2C - OVERSIGHT OF AUDIT:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THERE HAVE BEEN NO CHANGES DURING THE YEAR IN THE PROCESS FOR OVERSIGHT OF THE AUDIT OF THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.
